verses.original: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
verses.korean: 맨 처음에 하나님께서 하늘과 땅을 만드셨어요.

verses.original: The earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep and God's Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.
verses.korean: 그때 땅에는 아무것도 없었고, 깜깜한 어둠만 가득했어요. 하나님의 영이 물 위를 움직이고 계셨어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "빛이 생겨라!" 하고 말씀하시자, 빛이 생겼어요.

verses.original: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 빛을 보시고 참 좋다고 생각하셨어요. 그리고 빛과 어둠을 나누셨어요.

verses.original: God called the light "day", and the darkness he called "night". There was evening and there was morning, the first day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 빛을 "낮"이라고 부르시고, 어둠을 "밤"이라고 부르셨어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 이것이 첫째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be an expanse in the middle of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "물 사이에 하늘이 생겨서 물을 위아래로 나누어라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 하늘을 만드시고, 하늘 아래 물과 하늘 위 물을 나누셨어요. 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God called the expanse "sky". There was evening and there was morning, a second day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 이것을 "하늘"이라고 부르셨어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 둘째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "하늘 아래 물은 한곳에 모이고, 마른 땅이 나타나라!" 하고 말씀하시자 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God called the dry land "earth", and the gathering together of the waters he called "seas". God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 마른 땅을 "땅"이라 부르시고, 모인 물을 "바다"라고 부르셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the earth yield grass, herbs yielding seeds, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with their seeds in it, on the earth;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "땅에서 풀과 씨 맺는 채소와 열매 맺는 나무들이 자라나라!" 하고 말씀하시자 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: The earth yielded grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with their seeds in it, after their kind; and God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 땅에서 풀과 씨 맺는 채소와 열매 맺는 나무가 자라났어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 셋째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs to mark seasons, days, and years;
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "하늘에 빛들이 생겨서 낮과 밤을 나누고, 계절과 날과 해를 알려 주어라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: and let them be for lights in the expanse of the sky to give light on the earth;" and it was so.
verses.korean: "그 빛들이 땅을 비추어라!" 하시니 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 두 개의 큰 빛을 만드셨어요. 큰 빛은 낮을 다스리는 해이고, 작은 빛은 밤을 다스리는 달이에요. 별들도 만드셨어요.

verses.original: God set them in the expanse of the sky to give light to the earth,
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그것들을 하늘에 두시어 땅을 비추게 하셨어요.

verses.original: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 낮과 밤을 다스리고 빛과 어둠을 나누게 하셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 넷째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the waters abound with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of the sky."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "물에는 생물이 가득하고, 하늘에는 새들이 날아다녀라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: God created the large sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 큰 바다 동물들과 물에서 사는 모든 생물들, 그리고 날개 달린 새들을 만드셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그들에게 복을 주시며 말씀하셨어요. "많이 낳고 번성해서 바다와 땅을 가득 채워라!"

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 다섯째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the earth produce living creatures after their kind, livestock, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "땅에서 생물이 나와라! 가축과 기어 다니는 것과 들짐승이 나와라!" 하시니 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the livestock after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 들짐승과 가축과 기어 다니는 모든 것을 만드셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let's make man in our image, after our likeness. Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the livestock, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "우리의 모습을 닮은 사람을 만들자. 사람이 바다의 물고기와 하늘의 새와 가축과 온 땅과 기어 다니는 모든 것을 돌보게 하자."

verses.original: God created man in his own image. In God's image he created him; male and female he created them.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 자기 모습을 닮은 사람을 만드셨어요. 하나님의 모습대로 사람을 만드시되, 남자와 여자로 만드셨어요.

verses.original: God blessed them. God said to them, "Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그들에게 복을 주시며 말씀하셨어요. "많이 낳고 번성해서 땅을 가득 채워라. 바다의 물고기와 하늘의 새와 땅의 모든 생물을 잘 돌보아라."

verses.original: God said, "Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "보아라, 내가 씨 맺는 모든 채소와 열매 맺는 모든 나무를 너희에게 주었으니, 이것이 너희 음식이 될 것이다."

verses.original: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food;" and it was so.
verses.korean: "땅의 모든 동물과 하늘의 새와 기어 다니는 모든 것에게는 푸른 풀을 먹이로 주었다." 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 만드신 모든 것을 보시니, 정말 아주 좋았어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 여섯째 날이었어요.

verses.original: The heavens, the earth, and all their vast array were finished.
verses.korean: 하늘과 땅과 그 안에 있는 모든 것이 다 완성되었어요.

verses.original: On the seventh day God finished his work which he had done; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had done.
verses.korean: 일곱째 날에 하나님께서 하시던 일을 마치시고 쉬셨어요.

verses.original: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work of creation which he had done.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 일곱째 날에 복을 주시고 거룩하게 하셨어요. 이 날에 모든 창조 일을 마치고 쉬셨기 때문이에요.

verses.original: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens.
verses.korean: 이것은 하나님께서 하늘과 땅을 만드신 이야기예요.

verses.original: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground,
verses.korean: 아직 땅에는 식물도 없고 풀도 자라지 않았어요. 하나님께서 비를 내리지 않으셨고, 땅을 가꿀 사람도 없었기 때문이에요.

verses.original: but a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.
verses.korean: 하지만 안개가 땅에서 올라와 온 땅을 적셔 주었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅의 흙으로 사람을 빚으시고, 그 코에 생명의 숨을 불어넣어 주셨어요. 그래서 사람이 살아 있는 존재가 되었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 동쪽에 있는 에덴이라는 곳에 동산을 만드시고, 그곳에 만드신 사람을 두셨어요.

verses.original: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food, including the tree of life in the middle of the garden and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅에서 보기 좋고 먹기 좋은 나무들이 자라게 하셨어요. 동산 가운데에는 생명나무와 선과 악을 알게 하는 나무도 있었어요.

verses.original: A river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from there it was parted, and became the source of four rivers.
verses.korean: 에덴에서 강이 흘러나와 동산을 적셔 주었고, 그 강은 네 갈래로 나뉘었어요.

verses.original: The name of the first is Pishon: it flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
verses.korean: 첫째 강의 이름은 비손이에요. 이 강은 금이 나는 하윌라 땅을 흘러요.

verses.original: and the gold of that land is good. Bdellium and onyx stone are also there.
verses.korean: 그 땅의 금은 아주 좋고, 향료와 보석도 있어요.

verses.original: The name of the second river is Gihon. It is the same river that flows through the whole land of Cush.
verses.korean: 둘째 강의 이름은 기혼이에요. 이 강은 구스 땅을 흘러요.

verses.original: The name of the third river is Hiddekel. This is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.
verses.korean: 셋째 강의 이름은 힛데겔이에요. 이 강은 앗시리아 앞을 흘러요. 넷째 강은 유프라테스예요.

verses.original: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람을 에덴 동산에 두시고, 그곳을 돌보게 하셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "You may freely eat of every tree of the garden;
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람에게 말씀하셨어요. "동산에 있는 모든 나무의 열매는 마음껏 먹어도 좋다.

verses.original: but you shall not eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil; for in the day that you eat of it, you will surely die."
verses.korean: 하지만 선과 악을 알게 하는 나무의 열매는 먹지 마라. 그것을 먹으면 반드시 죽게 될 것이다."

verses.original: Yahweh God said, "It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make him a helper comparable to him."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "사람이 혼자 있는 것은 좋지 않다. 그를 도와줄 짝을 만들어 주겠다."

verses.original: Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field, and every bird of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called every living creature became its name.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 흙으로 들짐승과 하늘의 새들을 만드시고 사람에게 데려오셔서 이름을 짓게 하셨어요. 사람이 지은 이름이 그 동물의 이름이 되었어요.

verses.original: The man gave names to all livestock, and to the birds of the sky, and to every animal of the field; but for man there was not found a helper comparable to him.
verses.korean: 사람이 모든 가축과 하늘의 새와 들짐승에게 이름을 지어 주었어요. 하지만 사람을 도와줄 짝은 찾지 못했어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep. As the man slept, he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.
verses.korean: 그래서 하나님께서 사람을 깊이 잠들게 하시고, 그의 갈비뼈 하나를 꺼내신 후 그 자리를 살로 메우셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God made a woman from the rib which he had taken from the man, and brought her to the man.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그 갈비뼈로 여자를 만드시고 사람에게 데려오셨어요.

verses.original: The man said, "This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called 'woman,' because she was taken out of Man."
verses.korean: 사람이 말했어요. "드디어 나왔구나! 이 사람은 내 뼈에서 나온 뼈요, 내 살에서 나온 살이다. 남자에게서 나왔으니 '여자'라고 부르겠다."

verses.original: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.
verses.korean: 그래서 남자는 부모를 떠나 아내와 함께 살며, 둘이 한 몸이 되어요.

verses.original: The man and his wife were both naked, and they were not ashamed.
verses.korean: 그때 남자와 여자는 옷을 입지 않았지만 부끄러워하지 않았어요.

verses.original: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, "Has God really said, 'You shall not eat of any tree of the garden'?"
verses.korean: 뱀은 하나님께서 만드신 들짐승 중에서 가장 교활했어요. 뱀이 여자에게 물었어요. "하나님이 정말 동산의 나무 열매를 먹지 말라고 하셨니?"

verses.original: The woman said to the serpent, "We may eat fruit from the trees of the garden,
verses.korean: 여자가 뱀에게 대답했어요. "동산에 있는 나무 열매는 먹어도 돼.

verses.original: but not the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden. God has said, 'You shall not eat of it. You shall not touch it, lest you die.'"
verses.korean: 하지만 동산 가운데 있는 나무 열매만은 먹지도 만지지도 말라고 하셨어. 그러면 죽는다고 하셨거든."

verses.original: The serpent said to the woman, "You won't really die,
verses.korean: 뱀이 여자에게 말했어요. "죽지 않아.

verses.original: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil."
verses.korean: 하나님은 네가 그것을 먹으면 눈이 밝아져서 하나님처럼 선과 악을 알게 된다는 것을 아시거든."

verses.original: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took some of its fruit, and ate. Then she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate it, too.
verses.korean: 여자가 그 나무를 보니 열매가 맛있어 보이고, 눈에도 아름답고, 지혜로워지게 한다니 탐이 났어요. 그래서 열매를 따서 먹고, 함께 있던 남편에게도 주었어요. 남편도 그것을 먹었어요.

verses.original: Their eyes were opened, and they both knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made coverings for themselves.
verses.korean: 그러자 두 사람의 눈이 밝아져서 자기들이 옷을 입지 않았다는 것을 알게 되었어요. 그래서 무화과나무 잎을 엮어서 몸을 가렸어요.

verses.original: They heard Yahweh God's voice walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.
verses.korean: 저녁때 시원한 바람이 불 때, 하나님께서 동산을 거니시는 소리가 들렸어요. 남자와 여자는 하나님을 피해서 나무 사이에 숨었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God called to the man, and said to him, "Where are you?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 남자를 부르셨어요. "네가 어디 있느냐?"

verses.original: The man said, "I heard your voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; so I hid myself."
verses.korean: 남자가 대답했어요. "동산에서 하나님의 소리를 듣고 무서웠어요. 제가 옷을 입지 않아서 숨었어요."

verses.original: God said, "Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 물으셨어요. "네가 옷을 입지 않았다는 것을 누가 알려 주었느냐? 내가 먹지 말라고 한 나무 열매를 먹었느냐?"

verses.original: The man said, "The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it."
verses.korean: 남자가 대답했어요. "하나님께서 저에게 주신 이 여자가 열매를 주어서 제가 먹었어요."

verses.original: Yahweh God said to the woman, "What have you done?" The woman said, "The serpent deceived me, and I ate."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 여자에게 물으셨어요. "네가 무슨 짓을 한 것이냐?" 여자가 대답했어요. "뱀이 저를 속여서 제가 먹었어요."

verses.original: Yahweh God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. You shall go on your belly and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 뱀에게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 이런 일을 했으니, 모든 짐승 중에서 너는 저주를 받을 것이다. 배로 기어 다니며 평생 흙을 먹을 것이다.

verses.original: I will put hostility between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel."
verses.korean: 너와 여자 사이에, 네 자손과 여자의 자손 사이에 원수가 되게 하겠다. 여자의 자손이 네 머리를 밟을 것이고, 너는 그의 발꿈치를 물 것이다."

verses.original: To the woman he said, "I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. You will bear children in pain. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you."
verses.korean: 여자에게는 이렇게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 아이를 낳을 때 많이 아플 것이다. 고통 속에서 아이를 낳게 될 것이다."

verses.original: To Adam he said, "Because you have listened to your wife's voice, and ate from the tree, about which I commanded you, saying, 'You shall not eat of it,' the ground is cursed for your sake. You will eat from it with much labor all the days of your life.
verses.korean: 아담에게는 이렇게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 아내의 말을 듣고, 먹지 말라고 한 열매를 먹었으니, 땅이 너 때문에 저주를 받을 것이다. 평생 힘들게 일해야 먹을 것을 얻을 것이다.

verses.original: It will yield thorns and thistles to you; and you will eat the herb of the field.
verses.korean: 땅에서 가시덤불과 엉겅퀴가 날 것이고, 들의 채소를 먹을 것이다.

verses.original: You will eat bread by the sweat of your face until you return to the ground, for you were taken out of it. For you are dust, and you shall return to dust."
verses.korean: 땀을 흘리며 힘들게 일해야 빵을 먹을 수 있을 것이다. 결국 네가 나온 땅으로 돌아갈 것이다. 너는 흙에서 왔으니 다시 흙으로 돌아갈 것이다."

verses.original: The man called his wife Eve because she would be the mother of all the living.
verses.korean: 아담은 아내의 이름을 '하와'라고 지었어요. 하와는 모든 살아 있는 사람의 어머니가 될 것이기 때문이에요.

verses.original: Yahweh God made garments of animal skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아담과 그의 아내에게 가죽옷을 만들어 입혀 주셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God said, "Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he reach out his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever—"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "보아라, 사람이 선과 악을 알게 되어 우리처럼 되었다. 이제 생명나무 열매까지 따서 먹고 영원히 살게 해서는 안 된다."

verses.original: Therefore Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.
verses.korean: 그래서 하나님께서 아담을 에덴 동산에서 내보내시고, 그가 나온 땅을 농사짓게 하셨어요.

verses.original: So he drove out the man; and he placed cherubim at the east of the garden of Eden, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람을 쫓아내시고, 에덴 동산 동쪽에 그룹 천사들과 빙빙 돌아가는 불칼을 두어 생명나무로 가는 길을 지키게 하셨어요.

verses.original: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, "I have gotten a man with Yahweh's help."
verses.korean: 아담과 하와 사이에서 아들이 태어났어요. 하와가 말했어요. "하나님의 도움으로 아들을 얻었어요." 그래서 이름을 가인이라고 지었어요.

verses.original: Again she gave birth, to Cain's brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
verses.korean: 하와가 또 아들을 낳아 이름을 아벨이라고 지었어요. 아벨은 양을 치는 목자가 되었고, 가인은 농사를 짓는 사람이 되었어요.

verses.original: As time passed, Cain brought an offering to Yahweh from the fruit of the ground.
verses.korean: 시간이 지나서, 가인은 땅에서 거둔 곡식을 하나님께 제물로 드렸어요.

verses.original: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of its fat. Yahweh respected Abel and his offering,
verses.korean: 아벨도 양 떼 중에서 맏배로 태어난 것과 그 기름을 드렸어요. 하나님께서는 아벨과 그의 제물을 기쁘게 받으셨어요.

verses.original: but he didn't respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.
verses.korean: 하지만 가인과 그의 제물은 받지 않으셨어요. 가인은 매우 화가 나서 얼굴이 일그러졌어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Cain, "Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?
verses.korean: 하나님께서 가인에게 말씀하셨어요. "왜 화가 났느냐? 왜 얼굴이 그렇게 되었느냐?

verses.original: If you do well, won't it be lifted up? If you don't do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it."
verses.korean: 잘하면 기쁘게 받아들여질 것이다. 그러나 잘하지 못하면 죄가 문 앞에서 너를 노리고 있다. 죄가 너를 원하지만, 네가 죄를 이겨야 한다."

verses.original: Cain said to Abel, his brother, "Let's go into the field." While they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.
verses.korean: 가인이 동생 아벨에게 말했어요. "들로 나가자." 들에 있을 때, 가인이 동생 아벨을 공격해서 죽였어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Cain, "Where is Abel, your brother?" He said, "I don't know. Am I my brother's keeper?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 가인에게 물으셨어요. "네 동생 아벨이 어디 있느냐?" 가인이 대답했어요. "모릅니다. 제가 동생을 지키는 사람인가요?"

verses.original: Yahweh said, "What have you done? The voice of your brother's blood cries to me from the ground.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "네가 무슨 짓을 한 것이냐? 네 동생의 피가 땅에서 나에게 부르짖고 있다.

verses.original: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.
verses.korean: 이제 너는 저주를 받을 것이다. 땅이 입을 벌려 네 손에서 흘린 동생의 피를 받았기 때문이다.

verses.original: From now on, when you till the ground, it won't yield its strength to you. You will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth."
verses.korean: 이제부터 네가 농사를 지어도 땅이 열매를 내지 않을 것이다. 너는 세상을 떠돌아다니는 사람이 될 것이다."

verses.original: Cain said to Yahweh, "My punishment is greater than I can bear.
verses.korean: 가인이 하나님께 말했어요. "이 벌은 제가 감당하기에 너무 큽니다.

verses.original: Behold, you have driven me out today from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. Whoever finds me will kill me."
verses.korean: 보세요, 오늘 저를 이 땅에서 쫓아내시고 하나님 앞에서 숨어야 합니다. 떠돌아다니다가 만나는 사람마다 저를 죽이려 할 것입니다."

verses.original: Yahweh said to him, "Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold." Yahweh appointed a sign for Cain, so that anyone finding him would not strike him.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "가인을 죽이는 자는 일곱 배로 벌을 받을 것이다." 하나님께서 가인에게 표를 주셔서 누구도 그를 죽이지 못하게 하셨어요.

verses.original: Cain left Yahweh's presence, and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.korean: 가인은 하나님 앞을 떠나서 에덴 동쪽 놋 땅에 살았어요.

verses.original: Cain knew his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Enoch. He built a city, and named the city after the name of his son, Enoch.
verses.korean: 가인과 그의 아내 사이에서 에녹이 태어났어요. 가인은 성을 쌓고 아들의 이름을 따서 에녹이라고 불렀어요.

verses.original: Irad was born to Enoch. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.
verses.korean: 에녹에게서 이랏이, 이랏에게서 므후야엘이, 므후야엘에게서 므드사엘이, 므드사엘에게서 라멕이 태어났어요.

verses.original: Lamech took two wives: the name of the first one was Adah, and the name of the second one was Zillah.
verses.korean: 라멕은 두 아내를 맞이했어요. 한 명은 아다이고, 다른 한 명은 씰라예요.

verses.original: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.
verses.korean: 아다에게서 야발이 태어났어요. 야발은 천막에서 살며 가축을 기르는 사람들의 조상이 되었어요.

verses.original: His brother's name was Jubal, who was the father of all who handle the harp and pipe.
verses.korean: 야발의 동생 이름은 유발이에요. 유발은 수금과 피리를 연주하는 사람들의 조상이 되었어요.

verses.original: Zillah also gave birth to Tubal Cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of bronze and iron. Tubal Cain's sister was Naamah.
verses.korean: 씰라에게서도 두발가인이 태어났어요. 두발가인은 청동과 철로 연장을 만드는 사람이었어요. 두발가인의 여동생은 나아마예요.

verses.original: Lamech said to his wives, "Adah and Zillah, hear my voice. You wives of Lamech, listen to my speech, for I have slain a man for wounding me, a young man for bruising me.
verses.korean: 라멕이 아내들에게 말했어요. "아다와 씰라야, 내 말을 들어라. 나를 다치게 한 사람을 죽였고, 나를 때린 젊은이를 죽였다.

verses.original: If Cain will be avenged seven times, truly Lamech seventy-seven times."
verses.korean: 가인을 죽이면 일곱 배로 갚는다면, 라멕을 죽이면 일흔일곱 배로 갚을 것이다."

verses.original: Adam knew his wife again. She gave birth to a son, and named him Seth, saying, "for God has given me another child instead of Abel, for Cain killed him."
verses.korean: 아담과 하와 사이에서 또 아들이 태어났어요. 하와가 말했어요. "하나님께서 가인이 죽인 아벨 대신 다른 아들을 주셨어요." 그래서 이름을 셋이라고 지었어요.

verses.original: A son was also born to Seth, and he named him Enosh. At that time men began to call on Yahweh's name.
verses.korean: 셋에게도 아들이 태어났고, 이름을 에노스라고 지었어요. 그때부터 사람들이 하나님의 이름을 부르기 시작했어요.

verses.original: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God's likeness.
verses.korean: 이것은 아담의 자손들에 대한 이야기예요. 하나님께서 사람을 만드실 때, 하나님의 모습을 닮게 만드셨어요.

verses.original: He created them male and female, and blessed them. On the day they were created, he named them Adam.
verses.korean: 남자와 여자로 만드시고 복을 주셨어요. 만드신 날에 그들을 '아담'이라고 부르셨어요.

verses.original: Adam lived one hundred thirty years, and became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.
verses.korean: 아담은 130살에 자기를 닮은 아들을 낳고 셋이라고 이름 지었어요.

verses.original: The days of Adam after he became the father of Seth were eight hundred years, and he became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 셋을 낳은 후 아담은 800년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days that Adam lived were nine hundred thirty years, then he died.
verses.korean: 아담은 모두 930살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Seth lived one hundred five years, then became the father of Enosh.
verses.korean: 셋은 105살에 에노스를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Seth lived after he became the father of Enosh eight hundred seven years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 에노스를 낳은 후 807년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Seth were nine hundred twelve years, then he died.
verses.korean: 셋은 모두 912살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Enosh lived ninety years, and became the father of Kenan.
verses.korean: 에노스는 90살에 게난을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Enosh lived after he became the father of Kenan eight hundred fifteen years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 게난을 낳은 후 815년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.
verses.korean: 에노스는 모두 905살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Kenan lived seventy years, then became the father of Mahalalel.
verses.korean: 게난은 70살에 마할랄렐을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Kenan lived after he became the father of Mahalalel eight hundred forty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters
verses.korean: 마할랄렐을 낳은 후 840년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: and all of the days of Kenan were nine hundred ten years, then he died.
verses.korean: 게난은 모두 910살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Jared.
verses.korean: 마할랄렐은 65살에 야렛을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Mahalalel lived after he became the father of Jared eight hundred thirty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 야렛을 낳은 후 830년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety-five years, then he died.
verses.korean: 마할랄렐은 모두 895살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years, then became the father of Enoch.
verses.korean: 야렛은 162살에 에녹을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Jared lived after he became the father of Enoch eight hundred years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 에녹을 낳은 후 800년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, then he died.
verses.korean: 야렛은 모두 962살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Enoch lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Methuselah.
verses.korean: 에녹은 65살에 므두셀라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: After Methuselah's birth, Enoch walked with God for three hundred years, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 므두셀라를 낳은 후 에녹은 300년 동안 하나님과 함께 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.
verses.korean: 에녹은 모두 365살을 살았어요.

verses.original: Enoch walked with God, and he was not found, for God took him.
verses.korean: 에녹은 하나님과 함께 살았는데, 어느 날 사라졌어요. 하나님께서 그를 데려가셨기 때문이에요.

verses.original: Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, then became the father of Lamech.
verses.korean: 므두셀라는 187살에 라멕을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 라멕을 낳은 후 782년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, then he died.
verses.korean: 므두셀라는 모두 969살을 살다가 죽었어요. 성경에서 가장 오래 산 사람이에요!

verses.original: Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years, then became the father of a son.
verses.korean: 라멕은 182살에 아들을 낳았어요.

verses.original: He named him Noah, saying, "This one will comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, caused by the ground which Yahweh has cursed."
verses.korean: 그 아들의 이름을 노아라고 지으며 말했어요. "하나님께서 저주하신 땅에서 힘들게 일하는 우리를 이 아이가 위로해 줄 것이다."

verses.original: Lamech lived after he became the father of Noah five hundred ninety-five years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 노아를 낳은 후 595년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, then he died.
verses.korean: 라멕은 모두 777살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Noah was five hundred years old, then Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.korean: 노아는 500살이 되었을 때 셈, 함, 야벳 세 아들을 낳았어요.

verses.original: When men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,
verses.korean: 사람들이 땅 위에 많아지고 딸들도 태어났어요.

verses.original: God's sons saw that men's daughters were beautiful, and they took any that they wanted for themselves as wives.
verses.korean: 하나님의 아들들이 사람의 딸들이 예쁜 것을 보고, 마음에 드는 여자를 아내로 삼았어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said, "My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; so his days will be one hundred twenty years."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "내 영이 영원히 사람과 함께하지 않을 것이다. 사람은 육체일 뿐이니 수명을 120년으로 정하겠다."

verses.original: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God's sons came in to men's daughters and had children with them. Those were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.
verses.korean: 그 시대에 땅에는 네피림(거인들)이 있었어요. 하나님의 아들들과 사람의 딸들 사이에서 태어난 자녀들은 옛날의 유명한 용사들이었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of man's heart was continually only evil.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 보시니 사람들의 악함이 땅에 가득했어요. 사람들의 마음속 생각이 언제나 나쁜 것뿐이었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.
verses.korean: 하나님께서는 사람을 만드신 것을 후회하시고 마음 아파하셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said, "I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground—man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky—for I am sorry that I have made them."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "내가 만든 사람을 땅에서 없애 버리겠다. 사람뿐 아니라 짐승과 기어 다니는 것과 새까지 다 없애겠다. 그들을 만든 것이 후회되기 때문이다."

verses.original: But Noah found favor in Yahweh's eyes.
verses.korean: 하지만 노아만은 하나님께 사랑받았어요.

verses.original: This is the history of the generations of Noah: Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.
verses.korean: 이것은 노아에 대한 이야기예요. 노아는 그 시대 사람들 중에서 바르고 흠이 없는 사람이었어요. 노아는 하나님과 함께 살았어요.

verses.original: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.korean: 노아에게는 셈, 함, 야벳 세 아들이 있었어요.

verses.original: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
verses.korean: 그때 땅은 하나님 보시기에 타락했고, 온 땅에 폭력이 가득했어요.

verses.original: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅을 보시니, 모든 생물이 나쁜 길로 갔기 때문에 땅이 타락해 있었어요.

verses.original: God said to Noah, "I will bring an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them and the earth.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요. "모든 생물을 끝내려고 한다. 그들 때문에 땅에 폭력이 가득하기 때문이다. 그들을 땅과 함께 없애 버리겠다.

verses.original: Make a ship of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ship, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.
verses.korean: 너는 잣나무로 배를 만들어라. 배 안에 방들을 만들고, 안팎에 역청을 발라라.

verses.original: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ship shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
verses.korean: 이렇게 만들어라. 배의 길이는 300규빗(약 135미터), 너비는 50규빗(약 22미터), 높이는 30규빗(약 13미터)으로 해라.

verses.original: You shall make a roof in the ship, and you shall finish it to a cubit upward. You shall set the door of the ship in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.
verses.korean: 배에 지붕을 만들고, 위로 1규빗(약 45센티미터) 정도 남겨라. 배의 옆면에 문을 내고, 1층, 2층, 3층으로 만들어라.

verses.original: I, even I, will bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.
verses.korean: 보아라, 내가 땅 위에 홍수를 일으켜서 숨 쉬는 모든 생물을 없앨 것이다. 땅 위에 있는 모든 것이 죽을 것이다.

verses.original: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ship, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons' wives with you.
verses.korean: 하지만 너와는 약속을 세우겠다. 너와 네 아들들, 네 아내, 그리고 며느리들이 함께 배에 들어가라.

verses.original: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.
verses.korean: 모든 생물을 암컷과 수컷으로 한 쌍씩 배에 데리고 들어가서 살려 두어라.

verses.original: Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort will come to you, to keep them alive.
verses.korean: 새도 종류대로, 짐승도 종류대로, 기어 다니는 것도 종류대로 두 마리씩 네게 올 것이니 살려 두어라.

verses.original: Take with you some of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them."
verses.korean: 먹을 수 있는 모든 음식을 모아서 가져가라. 그것이 너와 동물들의 먹이가 될 것이다."

verses.original: Thus Noah did. He did all that God commanded him.
verses.korean: 노아는 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 다 했어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Noah, "Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요. "네 가족을 모두 데리고 배에 들어가라. 이 시대에 네가 나 앞에서 바르게 살았기 때문이다."

verses.original: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.
verses.korean: "정결한 동물은 암수 일곱 쌍씩 데려가고, 정결하지 않은 동물은 암수 한 쌍씩 데려가라."

verses.original: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.
verses.korean: "하늘의 새들도 암수 일곱 쌍씩 데려가서 온 땅에 생명이 이어지도록 하여라."

verses.original: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy every living thing that I have made from the surface of the ground."
verses.korean: "7일 후에 내가 40일 동안 밤낮으로 비를 내릴 것이다. 내가 만든 모든 생물을 땅에서 없애 버릴 것이다."

verses.original: Noah did everything that Yahweh commanded him.
verses.korean: 노아는 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 다 했어요.

verses.original: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.
verses.korean: 홍수가 땅에 쏟아졌을 때, 노아는 600살이었어요.

verses.original: Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives, because of the floodwaters.
verses.korean: 노아는 홍수를 피해 아들들과 아내, 며느리들과 함께 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Clean animals, unclean animals, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground
verses.korean: 정결한 동물과 정결하지 않은 동물, 새와 땅에 기어 다니는 것들이

verses.original: went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 암수 한 쌍씩 노아에게 와서 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: After the seven days, the floodwaters came on the earth.
verses.korean: 7일이 지나자 홍수가 땅에 쏟아졌어요.

verses.original: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day all the fountains of the great deep burst open, and the sky's windows opened.
verses.korean: 노아가 600살 되던 해 2월 17일에, 땅 밑의 모든 샘이 터지고 하늘의 창문이 열렸어요.

verses.original: It rained on the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.korean: 40일 동안 밤낮으로 비가 땅에 쏟아졌어요.

verses.original: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth—the sons of Noah—and Noah's wife and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship—
verses.korean: 바로 그날 노아와 그의 아들들 셈, 함, 야벳, 그리고 노아의 아내와 세 며느리가 함께 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.
verses.korean: 온갖 짐승과 가축, 땅에 기어 다니는 것, 그리고 모든 종류의 새들도 함께 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Pairs from all flesh with the breath of life in them went into the ship to Noah.
verses.korean: 숨 쉬는 모든 생물이 한 쌍씩 노아에게 와서 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; then Yahweh shut him in.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 모든 생물이 암수로 들어갔어요. 그리고 하나님께서 배의 문을 닫아 주셨어요.

verses.original: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth.
verses.korean: 40일 동안 홍수가 계속되었어요. 물이 점점 불어나서 배가 땅 위로 떠올랐어요.

verses.original: The waters rose, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters.
verses.korean: 물이 점점 더 많이 불어나서 배가 물 위에 둥둥 떠다녔어요.

verses.original: The waters rose very high on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.
verses.korean: 물이 땅 위에 아주 높이 올라와서 하늘 아래 모든 높은 산들이 물에 잠겼어요.

verses.original: The waters rose fifteen cubits higher, and the mountains were covered.
verses.korean: 물이 산보다 15규빗(약 7미터) 더 높이 올라와서 산들이 완전히 잠겼어요.

verses.original: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.
verses.korean: 땅 위에서 움직이던 모든 것이 죽었어요. 새, 가축, 짐승, 기어 다니는 것, 그리고 모든 사람이 죽었어요.

verses.original: All on the dry land, in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, died.
verses.korean: 코로 숨 쉬며 육지에 살던 모든 것이 죽었어요.

verses.original: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship.
verses.korean: 땅 위에 있던 모든 생물이 사라졌어요. 사람, 가축, 기어 다니는 것, 하늘의 새들까지 다 없어졌어요. 오직 노아와 배에 함께 있던 것들만 살아남았어요.

verses.original: The waters flooded the earth one hundred fifty days.
verses.korean: 물이 150일 동안 땅을 덮고 있었어요.

verses.original: God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아와 배에 있는 모든 동물과 가축을 기억하셨어요. 하나님께서 바람을 불게 하시자 물이 줄어들기 시작했어요.

verses.original: The deep's fountains and the sky's windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.
verses.korean: 땅 밑의 샘들과 하늘의 창문이 닫히고, 하늘에서 비가 그쳤어요.

verses.original: The waters continually receded from the earth. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters receded.
verses.korean: 물이 점점 땅에서 빠져나갔어요. 150일이 지나자 물이 많이 줄어들었어요.

verses.original: The ship rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat's mountains.
verses.korean: 7월 17일에 배가 아라랏 산 위에 머물렀어요.

verses.original: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were visible.
verses.korean: 물이 계속 줄어들어서 10월 1일이 되자 산꼭대기들이 보이기 시작했어요.

verses.original: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ship which he had made,
verses.korean: 40일이 지나서 노아가 배에 만들어 둔 창문을 열었어요.

verses.original: and he sent out a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.
verses.korean: 그리고 까마귀를 내보냈어요. 까마귀는 물이 마를 때까지 이리저리 날아다녔어요.

verses.original: He himself sent out a dove to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground,
verses.korean: 노아는 땅 위의 물이 줄어들었는지 알아보려고 비둘기를 내보냈어요.

verses.original: but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned into the ship to him, for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put out his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ship.
verses.korean: 하지만 비둘기는 발을 쉴 곳을 찾지 못하고 배로 돌아왔어요. 아직 온 땅이 물로 덮여 있었거든요. 노아는 손을 내밀어 비둘기를 받아 배 안으로 들였어요.

verses.original: He waited yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.
verses.korean: 7일을 더 기다린 후에 노아는 다시 비둘기를 내보냈어요.

verses.original: The dove came back to him at evening and, behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth.
verses.korean: 저녁때 비둘기가 돌아왔는데, 부리에 방금 딴 올리브 잎을 물고 있었어요! 그래서 노아는 물이 땅에서 빠졌다는 것을 알게 되었어요.

verses.original: He waited yet another seven days, and sent out the dove; and she didn't return to him any more.
verses.korean: 7일을 더 기다린 후에 다시 비둘기를 내보냈는데, 이번에는 돌아오지 않았어요.

verses.original: In the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
verses.korean: 노아가 601살 되던 해 1월 1일에 물이 땅에서 다 말랐어요. 노아가 배의 덮개를 열고 보니, 땅이 말라 있었어요.

verses.original: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
verses.korean: 2월 27일이 되자 땅이 완전히 말랐어요.

verses.original: God spoke to Noah, saying,
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: "Go out of the ship, you, your wife, your sons, and your sons' wives with you.
verses.korean: "너와 네 아내, 네 아들들과 며느리들이 배에서 나가라."

verses.original: Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth."
verses.korean: "너와 함께 있는 모든 생물도 데리고 나가라. 새, 가축, 땅에 기어 다니는 것들을 다 데리고 나가서 땅에서 번성하고 많아지게 하여라."

verses.original: Noah went out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives with him.
verses.korean: 노아가 아들들과 아내, 며느리들과 함께 배에서 나왔어요.

verses.original: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went out of the ship.
verses.korean: 모든 동물, 기어 다니는 것, 새들도 종류별로 배에서 나왔어요.

verses.original: Noah built an altar to Yahweh, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
verses.korean: 노아는 하나님께 제단을 쌓았어요. 그리고 정결한 동물과 정결한 새 중에서 골라 제단 위에 태워서 드렸어요.

verses.original: Yahweh smelled the pleasant aroma. Yahweh said in his heart, "I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake because the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth. I will never again strike every living thing, as I have done.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그 향기를 맡으시고 마음속으로 말씀하셨어요. "사람의 마음은 어릴 때부터 악하지만, 나는 다시는 사람 때문에 땅을 저주하지 않을 것이다. 다시는 모든 생물을 이렇게 치지 않을 것이다."

verses.original: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night will not cease."
verses.korean: "땅이 있는 동안 씨 뿌리는 때와 거두는 때, 추위와 더위, 여름과 겨울, 낮과 밤이 그치지 않을 것이다."

verses.original: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, "Be fruitful, multiply, and replenish the earth.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아와 그의 아들들에게 복을 주시며 말씀하셨어요. "많은 자녀를 낳아 땅을 가득 채워라."

verses.original: The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that moves along the ground, and all the fish of the sea, are delivered into your hand.
verses.korean: "땅의 모든 동물과 하늘의 새들이 너희를 무서워할 것이다. 땅에서 움직이는 모든 것과 바다의 물고기가 너희에게 맡겨졌다."

verses.original: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As I gave you the green herb, I have given everything to you.
verses.korean: "살아서 움직이는 모든 것을 먹어도 된다. 내가 전에 푸른 풀을 준 것처럼, 이제 모든 것을 너희에게 준다."

verses.original: But flesh with its life, that is, its blood, you shall not eat.
verses.korean: "하지만 피가 있는 채로 고기를 먹어서는 안 된다. 피는 생명이기 때문이다."

verses.original: I will surely require accounting for your life's blood. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man's brother, I will require the life of man.
verses.korean: "너희의 피, 곧 생명에 대해서 반드시 물을 것이다. 동물이든 사람이든, 사람의 생명을 해치면 책임을 물을 것이다."

verses.original: Whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.
verses.korean: "사람의 피를 흘리는 자는 사람에게 피를 흘릴 것이다. 하나님께서 사람을 자기 모습대로 만드셨기 때문이다."

verses.original: Be fruitful and multiply. Increase abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it."
verses.korean: "너희는 많은 자녀를 낳아 땅에 가득히 번성하여라."

verses.original: God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아와 그의 아들들에게 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: "As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you,
verses.korean: "내가 너희와 너희 후손들과 약속을 세우겠다."

verses.original: and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ship, even every animal of the earth.
verses.korean: "너희와 함께 있는 모든 생물, 곧 새, 가축, 배에서 나온 모든 땅의 동물과도 약속을 세우겠다."

verses.original: I will establish my covenant with you: All flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood. There will never again be a flood to destroy the earth."
verses.korean: "내가 너희와 약속한다. 다시는 홍수로 모든 생물을 멸하지 않을 것이다. 다시는 홍수로 땅을 멸망시키지 않을 것이다."

verses.original: God said, "This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "이것이 나와 너희, 그리고 너희와 함께 있는 모든 생물 사이에 영원히 세우는 약속의 표시이다."

verses.original: I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.
verses.korean: "내가 구름 속에 무지개를 두겠다. 이것이 나와 땅 사이의 약속의 표시가 될 것이다."

verses.original: When I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud,
verses.korean: "내가 땅 위에 구름을 일으킬 때 구름 속에 무지개가 나타날 것이다."

verses.original: I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
verses.korean: "그러면 나는 나와 너희, 그리고 모든 생물 사이에 세운 약속을 기억할 것이다. 다시는 물이 모든 생물을 멸하는 홍수가 되지 않을 것이다."

verses.original: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth."
verses.korean: "무지개가 구름 속에 나타나면, 내가 그것을 보고 하나님과 땅 위의 모든 생물 사이에 세운 영원한 약속을 기억할 것이다."

verses.original: God said to Noah, "This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요. "이것이 나와 땅 위의 모든 생물 사이에 세운 약속의 표시이다."

verses.original: The sons of Noah who went out from the ship were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan.
verses.korean: 배에서 나온 노아의 아들들은 셈, 함, 야벳이었어요. 함은 가나안의 아버지예요.

verses.original: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.
verses.korean: 이 세 사람이 노아의 아들들이었고, 온 땅의 모든 사람들이 이들에게서 퍼져 나갔어요.

verses.original: Noah began to be a farmer, and planted a vineyard.
verses.korean: 노아는 농사를 짓기 시작했고, 포도밭을 심었어요.

verses.original: He drank of the wine and got drunk. He was uncovered within his tent.
verses.korean: 노아가 포도주를 마시고 취해서 장막 안에서 벗은 채로 있었어요.

verses.original: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.
verses.korean: 가나안의 아버지인 함이 아버지가 벗고 있는 것을 보고 밖에 있는 두 형제에게 말했어요.

verses.original: Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn't see their father's nakedness.
verses.korean: 셈과 야벳은 옷을 가져다가 어깨에 메고 뒷걸음으로 들어가서 아버지를 덮어 드렸어요. 얼굴을 돌리고 있어서 아버지가 벗고 있는 것을 보지 않았어요.

verses.original: Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him.
verses.korean: 노아가 술에서 깨어나 막내아들이 자기에게 한 일을 알게 되었어요.

verses.original: He said, "Canaan is cursed. He will be a servant of servants to his brothers."
verses.korean: 노아가 말했어요. "가나안은 저주를 받을 것이다. 그는 형제들의 종 중의 종이 될 것이다."

verses.original: He said, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant.
verses.korean: 또 말했어요. "셈의 하나님, 여호와께서 찬양을 받으시기를! 가나안은 셈의 종이 되어라."

verses.original: May God enlarge Japheth. Let him dwell in the tents of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant."
verses.korean: "하나님께서 야벳을 넓혀 주시고 셈의 장막에 살게 하시기를! 가나안은 야벳의 종이 되어라."

verses.original: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.
verses.korean: 노아는 홍수 후에 350년을 더 살았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, and then he died.
verses.korean: 노아가 살았던 날은 모두 950년이었고, 그 후에 죽었어요.

verses.original: Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.
verses.korean: 이것은 노아의 아들들 셈, 함, 야벳의 이야기예요. 홍수 후에 그들에게 아들들이 태어났어요.

verses.original: The sons of Japheth were: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.korean: 야벳의 아들들은 고멜, 마곡, 마대, 야완, 두발, 메섹, 디라스예요.

verses.original: The sons of Gomer were: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.korean: 고멜의 아들들은 아스그나스, 리밧, 도갈마예요.

verses.original: The sons of Javan were: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
verses.korean: 야완의 아들들은 엘리사, 다시스, 깃딤, 도다님이에요.

verses.original: Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.
verses.korean: 이들에게서 섬과 바닷가에 사는 나라들이 갈라져 나왔어요. 각각 자기 말과 가족과 나라로 나뉘었어요.

verses.original: The sons of Ham were: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
verses.korean: 함의 아들들은 구스, 미스라임, 붓, 가나안이에요.

verses.original: The sons of Cush were: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were: Sheba and Dedan.
verses.korean: 구스의 아들들은 스바, 하윌라, 삽다, 라아마, 삽드가예요. 라아마의 아들들은 스바와 드단이에요.

verses.original: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.
verses.korean: 구스에게서 니므롯이 태어났어요. 니므롯은 세상에서 힘센 사람이 되었어요.

verses.original: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, "like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh".
verses.korean: 그는 하나님 앞에서 대단한 사냥꾼이었어요. 그래서 "하나님 앞에 니므롯 같은 대단한 사냥꾼"이라는 말이 생겼어요.

verses.original: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
verses.korean: 그의 나라는 시날 땅에 있는 바벨, 에렉, 악갓, 갈레에서 시작되었어요.

verses.original: Out of that land he went into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,
verses.korean: 그는 그 땅에서 앗시리아로 가서 니느웨, 르호보딜, 갈라를 세웠어요.

verses.original: and Resen between Nineveh and the great city Calah.
verses.korean: 니느웨와 큰 성읍 갈라 사이에 레센도 세웠어요.

verses.original: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
verses.korean: 미스라임에게서 루딤, 아나밈, 르하빔, 납두힘이 태어났어요.

verses.original: Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.
verses.korean: 그리고 바드루심, 가슬루힘, 갑도림도 태어났어요. 블레셋 사람들은 가슬루힘에게서 나왔어요.

verses.original: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,
verses.korean: 가나안은 맏아들 시돈과 헷을 낳았어요.

verses.original: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
verses.korean: 또한 여부스 족속, 아모리 족속, 기르가스 족속의 조상이 되었어요.

verses.original: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
verses.korean: 히위 족속, 아르기 족속, 신 족속의 조상도 되었어요.

verses.original: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.
verses.korean: 아르왓 족속, 스말 족속, 하맛 족속의 조상도 되었어요. 그 후에 가나안 족속들이 사방으로 퍼져 나갔어요.

verses.original: The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon—as you go toward Gerar—to Gaza—as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim—to Lasha.
verses.korean: 가나안 땅의 경계는 시돈에서 그랄까지, 가사에서 소돔, 고모라, 아드마, 스보임, 라사까지였어요.

verses.original: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, according to their languages, in their lands and their nations.
verses.korean: 이들이 함의 자손들이에요. 각각 가족과 언어와 땅과 나라로 나뉘었어요.

verses.original: Children were also born to Shem (the elder brother of Japheth), the father of all the children of Eber.
verses.korean: 야벳의 형인 셈에게도 자녀들이 태어났어요. 셈은 에벨의 모든 자손의 조상이에요.

verses.original: The sons of Shem were: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
verses.korean: 셈의 아들들은 엘람, 앗수르, 아르박삿, 룻, 아람이에요.

verses.original: The sons of Aram were: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
verses.korean: 아람의 아들들은 우스, 훌, 게델, 마스예요.

verses.original: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber.
verses.korean: 아르박삿은 셀라를 낳았고, 셀라는 에벨을 낳았어요.

verses.original: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan.
verses.korean: 에벨에게 두 아들이 태어났어요. 하나는 벨렉이라 했는데, 그 시대에 땅이 나뉘었기 때문이에요. 다른 아들의 이름은 욕단이에요.

verses.original: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.korean: 욕단은 알모닷, 셀렙, 하살마웻, 예라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.korean: 또 하도람, 우살, 디글라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.korean: 또 오발, 아비마엘, 스바를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.korean: 또 오빌, 하윌라, 요밥을 낳았어요. 이들이 다 욕단의 아들들이에요.

verses.original: Their dwelling extended from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.
verses.korean: 그들이 사는 곳은 메사에서 동쪽 산지인 스발까지였어요.

verses.original: These are the sons of Shem, by their families, according to their languages, lands, and nations.
verses.korean: 이들이 셈의 자손들이에요. 각각 가족과 언어와 땅과 나라로 나뉘었어요.

verses.original: These are the families of the sons of Noah, by their generations, according to their nations. The nations divided from these in the earth after the flood.
verses.korean: 이들이 노아의 아들들에게서 나온 가족들이에요. 홍수 후에 이들에게서 땅의 모든 나라가 퍼져 나갔어요.

verses.original: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
verses.korean: 그때 온 세상 사람들은 같은 말을 사용했어요.

verses.original: As they traveled from the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there.
verses.korean: 사람들이 동쪽에서 옮겨 오다가 시날 땅에 있는 평야를 발견하고 거기서 살았어요.

verses.original: They said to one another, "Come, let's make bricks, and burn them thoroughly." They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.
verses.korean: 그들이 서로 말했어요. "자, 벽돌을 만들어 단단히 굽자." 그래서 그들은 돌 대신 벽돌을 쓰고, 진흙 대신 역청(끈적끈적한 것)을 썼어요.

verses.original: They said, "Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."
verses.korean: 그들이 말했어요. "자, 도시를 세우고 하늘에 닿는 높은 탑을 쌓자. 우리 이름을 떨치자. 그래야 온 땅에 흩어지지 않을 것이다."

verses.original: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람들이 짓고 있는 도시와 탑을 보러 내려오셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said, "Behold, they are one people, and they all have one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "보아라, 그들은 한 백성이고 모두 같은 말을 하는구나. 이제 시작한 일인데, 앞으로는 무슨 일이든 하려고 하겠구나."

verses.original: Come, let's go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another's speech."
verses.korean: "자, 내려가서 그들의 말을 뒤섞어 서로 알아듣지 못하게 하자."

verses.original: So Yahweh scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city.
verses.korean: 그래서 하나님께서 그들을 거기서 온 땅으로 흩으셨어요. 그들은 도시 짓는 것을 멈추었어요.

verses.original: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there Yahweh confused the language of all the earth. From there, Yahweh scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.
verses.korean: 그래서 그곳 이름을 바벨이라고 했어요. 하나님께서 거기서 온 세상의 말을 뒤섞으셨기 때문이에요. 하나님께서 그곳에서 사람들을 온 땅으로 흩으셨어요.

verses.original: This is the history of the generations of Shem: Shem was one hundred years old when he became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood.
verses.korean: 이것은 셈의 이야기예요. 셈은 100살에 아르박삿을 낳았는데, 그것은 홍수 후 2년째 되던 해였어요.

verses.original: Shem lived five hundred years after he became the father of Arpachshad, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 셈은 아르박삿을 낳은 후 500년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Arpachshad lived thirty-five years and became the father of Shelah.
verses.korean: 아르박삿은 35살에 셀라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Arpachshad lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Shelah, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 아르박삿은 셀라를 낳은 후 403년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Shelah lived thirty years, and became the father of Eber.
verses.korean: 셀라는 30살에 에벨을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Shelah lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Eber, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 셀라는 에벨을 낳은 후 403년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg.
verses.korean: 에벨은 34살에 벨렉을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Eber lived four hundred thirty years after he became the father of Peleg, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 에벨은 벨렉을 낳은 후 430년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Peleg lived thirty years, and became the father of Reu.
verses.korean: 벨렉은 30살에 르우를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Peleg lived two hundred nine years after he became the father of Reu, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 벨렉은 르우를 낳은 후 209년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Reu lived thirty-two years, and became the father of Serug.
verses.korean: 르우는 32살에 스룩을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Reu lived two hundred seven years after he became the father of Serug, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 르우는 스룩을 낳은 후 207년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Serug lived thirty years, and became the father of Nahor.
verses.korean: 스룩은 30살에 나홀을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Serug lived two hundred years after he became the father of Nahor, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 스룩은 나홀을 낳은 후 200년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and became the father of Terah.
verses.korean: 나홀은 29살에 데라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Nahor lived one hundred nineteen years after he became the father of Terah, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 나홀은 데라를 낳은 후 119년을 더 살면서 아들딸을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Terah lived seventy years, and became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verses.korean: 데라는 70살에 아브람, 나홀, 하란을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Now this is the history of the generations of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran became the father of Lot.
verses.korean: 이것은 데라의 이야기예요. 데라는 아브람, 나홀, 하란을 낳았어요. 하란은 롯을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Haran died in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldees, while his father Terah was still alive.
verses.korean: 하란은 아버지 데라가 살아 있을 때 자기가 태어난 땅, 갈대아의 우르에서 죽었어요.

verses.original: Abram and Nahor married wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife was Milcah, the daughter of Haran, who was also the father of Iscah.
verses.korean: 아브람과 나홀은 아내를 맞이했어요. 아브람의 아내 이름은 사래였고, 나홀의 아내 이름은 밀가였는데, 밀가는 하란의 딸이었어요. 하란은 이스가의 아버지이기도 했어요.

verses.original: Sarai was barren. She had no child.
verses.korean: 사래는 아이를 낳지 못했어요. 자녀가 없었어요.

verses.original: Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son's son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram's wife. They went from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran and lived there.
verses.korean: 데라는 아들 아브람과 손자 롯(하란의 아들), 며느리 사래(아브람의 아내)를 데리고 갈대아의 우르를 떠나 가나안 땅으로 가려고 했어요. 그들은 하란에 이르러 거기서 살았어요.

verses.original: The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.
verses.korean: 데라는 205년을 살다가 하란에서 죽었어요.

verses.original: Now Yahweh said to Abram, "Leave your country, and your relatives, and your father's house, and go to the land that I will show you.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아브람에게 말씀하셨어요. "네 고향과 친척과 아버지의 집을 떠나, 내가 보여줄 땅으로 가라."

verses.original: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing.
verses.korean: "내가 너를 큰 민족으로 만들고 네게 복을 주겠다. 네 이름을 크게 하겠다. 너는 복의 근원이 될 것이다."

verses.original: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who treats you with contempt. All the families of the earth will be blessed through you."
verses.korean: "너를 축복하는 사람은 내가 축복하고, 너를 저주하는 사람은 내가 저주할 것이다. 땅의 모든 가족이 너로 인해 복을 받을 것이다."

verses.original: So Abram went, as Yahweh had told him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed from Haran.
verses.korean: 아브람은 하나님께서 말씀하신 대로 떠났어요. 롯도 함께 갔어요. 아브람이 하란을 떠날 때 75살이었어요.

verses.original: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother's son, all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people whom they had acquired in Haran, and they went to go into the land of Canaan. They entered into the land of Canaan.
verses.korean: 아브람은 아내 사래와 조카 롯, 그동안 모은 재산과 하란에서 얻은 사람들을 데리고 가나안 땅으로 갔어요. 그들은 가나안 땅에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. At that time, Canaanites were in the land.
verses.korean: 아브람은 그 땅을 지나 세겜의 모레 상수리나무가 있는 곳까지 갔어요. 그때 가나안 사람들이 그 땅에 살고 있었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh appeared to Abram and said, "I will give this land to your offspring." He built an altar there to Yahweh, who had appeared to him.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아브람에게 나타나 말씀하셨어요. "이 땅을 네 자손에게 주겠다." 아브람은 자기에게 나타나신 하나님께 제단을 쌓았어요.

verses.original: He left from there to go to the mountain on the east of Bethel and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on Yahweh's name.
verses.korean: 그곳에서 벧엘 동쪽 산으로 옮겨 가서 장막을 쳤어요. 서쪽에는 벧엘이, 동쪽에는 아이가 있었어요. 거기서도 하나님께 제단을 쌓고 하나님의 이름을 불렀어요.

verses.original: Abram traveled, still going on toward the South.
verses.korean: 아브람은 계속 남쪽으로 여행했어요.

verses.original: There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was severe in the land.
verses.korean: 그때 그 땅에 흉년이 들었어요. 흉년이 심해서 아브람은 이집트로 내려가 잠시 살기로 했어요.

verses.original: When he had come near to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, "See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look at.
verses.korean: 이집트에 가까이 왔을 때, 아브람이 아내 사래에게 말했어요. "당신은 정말 아름다운 여자예요."

verses.original: It will happen, when the Egyptians see you, that they will say, 'This is his wife.' They will kill me, but they will save you alive.
verses.korean: "이집트 사람들이 당신을 보면 '이 사람은 그의 아내다' 할 거예요. 그러면 나는 죽이고 당신은 살려둘 거예요."

verses.original: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you."
verses.korean: "그러니 당신이 내 누이라고 해 주세요. 그래야 당신 덕분에 내가 잘되고 살 수 있어요."

verses.original: When Abram had come into Egypt, Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.
verses.korean: 아브람이 이집트에 들어가자, 이집트 사람들은 그 여자가 매우 아름다운 것을 보았어요.

verses.original: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.
verses.korean: 바로의 신하들이 그녀를 보고 바로에게 칭찬했어요. 그래서 그녀는 바로의 왕궁으로 데려가졌어요.

verses.original: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.
verses.korean: 바로는 그녀 때문에 아브람을 잘 대해 주었어요. 아브람은 양, 소, 나귀, 남종과 여종, 암나귀와 낙타를 얻었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.
verses.korean: 그런데 하나님께서 아브람의 아내 사래 때문에 바로와 그의 집에 큰 재앙을 내리셨어요.

verses.original: Pharaoh called Abram and said, "What is this that you have done to me? Why didn't you tell me that she was your wife?
verses.korean: 바로가 아브람을 불러 말했어요. "당신이 나에게 무슨 짓을 한 거요? 왜 그녀가 당신의 아내라고 말하지 않았소?"

verses.original: Why did you say, 'She is my sister,' so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way."
verses.korean: "왜 '그녀는 내 누이요'라고 해서 내가 그녀를 아내로 삼게 했소? 자, 당신의 아내를 데리고 가시오."

verses.original: Pharaoh commanded men concerning him, and they escorted him away with his wife and all that he had.
verses.korean: 바로는 신하들에게 명령해서 아브람과 그의 아내, 그의 모든 소유를 데리고 나가게 했어요.

verses.original: Abram went up out of Egypt—he, his wife, all that he had, and Lot with him—into the South.
verses.korean: 아브람은 아내와 모든 소유와 롯을 데리고 이집트에서 올라와 남쪽 지방으로 갔어요.

verses.original: Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
verses.korean: 아브람은 가축과 은과 금이 아주 많았어요.

verses.original: He went on his journeys from the South as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
verses.korean: 아브람은 남쪽 지방에서 벧엘까지 여행하며, 처음에 장막을 쳤던 벧엘과 아이 사이에 이르렀어요.

verses.original: to the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first. There Abram called on Yahweh's name.
verses.korean: 그곳은 전에 제단을 쌓았던 자리였어요. 거기서 아브람은 하나님의 이름을 불렀어요.

verses.original: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, herds, and tents.
verses.korean: 아브람과 함께 다니던 롯도 양 떼와 소 떼와 장막이 있었어요.

verses.original: The land was not able to bear them, that they might live together; for their possessions were so great that they couldn't live together.
verses.korean: 그런데 그들의 재산이 너무 많아서 그 땅이 그들을 다 감당할 수 없었어요. 그래서 함께 살 수가 없었어요.

verses.original: There was strife between the herdsmen of Abram's livestock and the herdsmen of Lot's livestock. The Canaanites and the Perizzites lived in the land at that time.
verses.korean: 아브람의 목자들과 롯의 목자들 사이에 다툼이 생겼어요. 그때 가나안 사람들과 브리스 사람들이 그 땅에 살고 있었어요.

verses.original: Abram said to Lot, "Please, let there be no strife between you and me, and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen; for we are relatives.
verses.korean: 아브람이 롯에게 말했어요. "우리 사이에, 그리고 우리 목자들 사이에 다투지 말자. 우리는 가족이잖아."

verses.original: Isn't the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right hand, then I will go to the left."
verses.korean: "온 땅이 네 앞에 있지 않느냐? 나에게서 떨어지자. 네가 왼쪽으로 가면 나는 오른쪽으로 가고, 네가 오른쪽으로 가면 나는 왼쪽으로 가겠다."

verses.original: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.
verses.korean: 롯이 눈을 들어 보니, 요단 평야 전체가 물이 풍부했어요. 하나님께서 소돔과 고모라를 멸망시키기 전이라, 소알까지 마치 하나님의 동산 같고 이집트 땅 같았어요.

verses.original: So Lot chose the Plain of the Jordan for himself. Lot traveled east, and they separated themselves from one other.
verses.korean: 그래서 롯은 요단 평야를 골랐어요. 롯은 동쪽으로 옮겨 갔고, 그들은 서로 헤어졌어요.

verses.original: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived in the cities of the plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.
verses.korean: 아브람은 가나안 땅에 살았고, 롯은 평야의 성읍들에 살면서 소돔 가까이까지 장막을 옮겼어요.

verses.original: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinners against Yahweh.
verses.korean: 그런데 소돔 사람들은 매우 악하고 하나님께 크게 죄를 짓는 사람들이었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Abram, after Lot was separated from him, "Now, lift up your eyes, and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward,
verses.korean: 롯이 떠난 후에 하나님께서 아브람에게 말씀하셨어요. "눈을 들어 네가 있는 곳에서 북쪽과 남쪽과 동쪽과 서쪽을 바라보아라."

verses.original: for I will give all the land which you see to you and to your offspring forever.
verses.korean: "네가 보는 이 모든 땅을 내가 너와 네 자손에게 영원히 주겠다."

verses.original: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can count the dust of the earth, then your offspring may also be counted.
verses.korean: "내가 네 자손을 땅의 티끌처럼 많게 하겠다. 사람이 땅의 티끌을 셀 수 있다면 네 자손도 셀 수 있을 것이다."

verses.original: Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its width; for I will give it to you."
verses.korean: "일어나 이 땅을 가로세로 두루 다녀 보아라. 내가 이 땅을 너에게 주겠다."

verses.original: Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to Yahweh.
verses.korean: 아브람은 장막을 옮겨 헤브론에 있는 마므레 상수리나무 곁에 가서 살았어요. 그리고 거기서 하나님께 제단을 쌓았어요.

verses.original: In the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar; Arioch, king of Ellasar; Chedorlaomer, king of Elam; and Tidal, king of Goiim,
verses.korean: 시날 왕 아므라벨, 엘라살 왕 아리옥, 엘람 왕 그돌라오멜, 고임 왕 디달 시대에 이런 일이 있었어요.

verses.original: they made war with Bera, king of Sodom; Birsha, king of Gomorrah; Shinab, king of Admah; Shemeber, king of Zeboiim; and the king of Bela (also called Zoar).
verses.korean: 이 왕들이 소돔 왕 베라, 고모라 왕 비르사, 아드마 왕 시납, 스보임 왕 세메벨, 벨라(소알) 왕과 전쟁을 벌였어요.

verses.original: All these joined together in the valley of Siddim (also called the Salt Sea).
verses.korean: 이들은 싯딤 골짜기(지금의 염해)에 함께 모였어요.

verses.original: They served Chedorlaomer for twelve years, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.korean: 그들은 12년 동안 그돌라오멜을 섬겼는데, 13년째 되는 해에 반역했어요.

verses.original: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came, and the kings who were with him, and struck the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
verses.korean: 14년째 되는 해에 그돌라오멜과 그와 함께한 왕들이 와서 아스드롯 가르나임에서 르바임 족속을, 함에서 수심 족속을, 사웨 기랴다임에서 에밈 족속을 쳤어요.

verses.original: and the Horites in their Mount Seir, to El Paran, which is by the wilderness.
verses.korean: 그리고 세일 산에서 호리 족속을 쳐서 광야 근처 엘바란까지 갔어요.

verses.original: They returned, and came to En Mishpat (also called Kadesh), and struck all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that lived in Hazazon Tamar.
verses.korean: 그들은 돌아와 엔미스밧(가데스)에 이르러 아말렉 온 지역과 하사손다말에 사는 아모리 족속을 쳤어요.

verses.original: The king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also called Zoar) went out; and they set the battle in array against them in the valley of Siddim
verses.korean: 소돔 왕, 고모라 왕, 아드마 왕, 스보임 왕, 벨라(소알) 왕이 나가서 싯딤 골짜기에서 그들과 싸울 준비를 했어요.

verses.original: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goiim, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.
verses.korean: 엘람 왕 그돌라오멜, 고임 왕 디달, 시날 왕 아므라벨, 엘라살 왕 아리옥, 이렇게 네 왕이 다섯 왕과 맞섰어요.

verses.original: Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and some fell there. Those who remained fled to the hills.
verses.korean: 그런데 싯딤 골짜기에는 역청 구덩이가 많았어요. 소돔 왕과 고모라 왕이 도망치다가 거기 빠졌고, 나머지는 산으로 도망쳤어요.

verses.original: They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way.
verses.korean: 이긴 쪽이 소돔과 고모라의 모든 재물과 양식을 빼앗아 가져갔어요.

verses.original: They took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
verses.korean: 그들은 소돔에 살던 아브람의 조카 롯과 그의 재물도 함께 잡아갔어요.

verses.original: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. At that time, he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner. They were allies of Abram.
verses.korean: 도망친 사람 중 하나가 와서 히브리 사람 아브람에게 알려 주었어요. 그때 아브람은 에스골과 아넬의 형제인 아모리 사람 마므레의 상수리나무 곁에 살고 있었어요. 그들은 아브람과 동맹을 맺은 사람들이었어요.

verses.original: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led out his three hundred eighteen trained men, born in his house, and pursued as far as Dan.
verses.korean: 아브람은 친척이 잡혀갔다는 소식을 듣고, 자기 집에서 태어난 훈련받은 종 318명을 이끌고 단까지 쫓아갔어요.

verses.original: He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
verses.korean: 아브람은 밤에 그의 종들과 함께 무리를 나누어 그들을 쳐서 다메섹 왼쪽에 있는 호바까지 쫓아갔어요.

verses.original: He brought back all the goods, and also brought back his relative Lot and his goods, and the women also, and the other people.
verses.korean: 아브람은 모든 재물을 되찾아 왔어요. 친척 롯과 그의 재물, 여자들과 다른 사람들도 다 데려왔어요.

verses.original: The king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley).
verses.korean: 아브람이 그돌라오멜과 그와 함께한 왕들을 치고 돌아오자, 소돔 왕이 사웨 골짜기(왕의 골짜기)로 나와 그를 맞이했어요.

verses.original: Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. He was priest of God Most High.
verses.korean: 살렘 왕 멜기세덱이 빵과 포도주를 가지고 나왔어요. 그는 지극히 높으신 하나님의 제사장이었어요.

verses.original: He blessed him, and said, "Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth.
verses.korean: 멜기세덱이 아브람에게 복을 빌며 말했어요. "하늘과 땅을 지으신 지극히 높으신 하나님께서 아브람에게 복을 주시기를 원합니다."

verses.original: Blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand." Abram gave him a tenth of all.
verses.korean: "당신의 원수들을 당신 손에 넘겨주신 지극히 높으신 하나님을 찬양합니다." 아브람은 모든 것의 십분의 일을 그에게 드렸어요.

verses.original: The king of Sodom said to Abram, "Give me the people, and take the goods for yourself."
verses.korean: 소돔 왕이 아브람에게 말했어요. "사람들은 나에게 주고, 재물은 당신이 가지세요."

verses.original: Abram said to the king of Sodom, "I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,
verses.korean: 아브람이 소돔 왕에게 말했어요. "하늘과 땅을 지으신 지극히 높으신 하나님 앞에서 맹세합니다."

verses.original: that I will not take a thread nor a sandal strap nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, 'I have made Abram rich.'
verses.korean: "당신의 것은 실 한 오라기나 신발 끈 하나도 받지 않겠습니다. 그래야 당신이 '내가 아브람을 부자로 만들었다'고 말하지 못할 것입니다."

verses.original: I will accept nothing from you except that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. Let them take their portion."
verses.korean: "젊은이들이 먹은 것과 나와 함께 간 아넬, 에스골, 마므레의 몫만 받겠습니다. 그들은 자기 몫을 가져가게 하세요."

verses.original: After these things Yahweh's word came to Abram in a vision, saying, "Don't be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward."
verses.korean: 이 일들이 있은 후에 하나님의 말씀이 환상 가운데 아브람에게 왔어요. "아브람아, 두려워하지 마라. 내가 너의 방패이고, 너의 아주 큰 상이다."

verses.original: Abram said, "Lord Yahweh, what will you give me, since I go childless, and he who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?"
verses.korean: 아브람이 말했어요. "주 하나님, 제게 무엇을 주시렵니까? 저는 자녀가 없어서 다메섹 사람 엘리에셀이 제 재산을 물려받게 되었습니다."

verses.original: Abram said, "Behold, you have given no children to me: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir."
verses.korean: 아브람이 또 말했어요. "보세요, 하나님께서 저에게 자녀를 주지 않으셨습니다. 그래서 제 집에서 태어난 종이 저의 상속자가 됩니다."

verses.original: Behold, Yahweh's word came to him, saying, "This man will not be your heir, but he who will come out of your own body will be your heir."
verses.korean: 그때 하나님의 말씀이 아브람에게 왔어요. "이 사람이 너의 상속자가 아니다. 네 몸에서 태어날 아이가 너의 상속자가 될 것이다."

verses.original: Yahweh brought him outside, and said, "Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them." He said to Abram, "So your offspring will be."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아브람을 밖으로 데리고 나가셨어요. 그리고 말씀하셨어요. "하늘을 보고 별을 세어 보아라. 네가 셀 수 있다면 말이다." 그리고 아브람에게 말씀하셨어요. "네 자손이 이처럼 많아질 것이다."

verses.original: He believed in Yahweh, who credited it to him for righteousness.
verses.korean: 아브람이 하나님을 믿었어요. 하나님께서는 그의 믿음을 의로 여기셨어요.

verses.original: He said to Abram, "I am Yahweh who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land to inherit it."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아브람에게 말씀하셨어요. "나는 너를 갈대아 우르에서 이끌어낸 하나님이다. 이 땅을 너에게 주어 네 것으로 삼게 하려고 했다."

verses.original: He said, "Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?"
verses.korean: 아브람이 물었어요. "주 하나님, 제가 이 땅을 물려받을 것을 어떻게 알 수 있습니까?"

verses.original: He said to him, "Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "세 살 된 암송아지와 세 살 된 암염소와 세 살 된 숫양과 산비둘기 한 마리와 집비둘기 새끼 한 마리를 나에게 가져오너라."

verses.original: He brought him all these, and divided them in the middle, and laid each half opposite the other; but he didn't divide the birds.
verses.korean: 아브람이 이것들을 모두 가져와서 가운데로 쪼개어 한쪽과 다른 쪽을 마주 보게 놓았어요. 그러나 새는 쪼개지 않았어요.

verses.original: The birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
verses.korean: 솔개들이 그 고기 위로 내려왔지만, 아브람이 쫓아버렸어요.

verses.original: When the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. Now terror and great darkness fell on him.
verses.korean: 해가 질 무렵 아브람이 깊은 잠에 빠졌어요. 그때 무서움과 짙은 어둠이 그에게 덮쳤어요.

verses.original: He said to Abram, "Know for sure that your offspring will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아브람에게 말씀하셨어요. "이것을 확실히 알아라. 네 자손이 자기 땅이 아닌 곳에서 나그네로 살면서 그들을 섬기게 될 것이다. 그들이 사백 년 동안 고통받을 것이다."

verses.original: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth;
verses.korean: "그러나 그들을 부리는 나라를 내가 벌할 것이다. 그 후에 네 자손이 많은 재물을 가지고 나올 것이다."

verses.original: but you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried at a good old age.
verses.korean: "너는 평안히 조상들에게로 가게 될 것이다. 좋은 나이에 묻히게 될 것이다."

verses.original: In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full."
verses.korean: "네 자손은 사대 만에 이 땅으로 돌아올 것이다. 아모리 사람의 죄악이 아직 가득 차지 않았기 때문이다."

verses.original: It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.
verses.korean: 해가 지고 어두워졌을 때, 연기 나는 화덕과 타오르는 횃불이 쪼갠 고기 사이로 지나갔어요.

verses.original: In that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram, saying, "I have given this land to your offspring, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:
verses.korean: 그 날 하나님께서 아브람과 약속을 맺으시며 말씀하셨어요. "내가 이 땅을 네 자손에게 주었다. 이집트 강에서부터 큰 강 유프라테스까지이다."

verses.original: the land of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
verses.korean: "겐 사람과 그니스 사람과 갓몬 사람의 땅과"

verses.original: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
verses.korean: "헷 사람과 브리스 사람과 르바 사람의 땅과"

verses.original: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites."
verses.korean: "아모리 사람과 가나안 사람과 기르가스 사람과 여부스 사람의 땅이다."

verses.original: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children. She had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
verses.korean: 아브람의 아내 사래는 아이를 낳지 못했어요. 사래에게는 이집트 사람 하갈이라는 여종이 있었어요.

verses.original: Sarai said to Abram, "See now, Yahweh has restrained me from bearing. Please go in to my servant. It may be that I will obtain children by her." Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.
verses.korean: 사래가 아브람에게 말했어요. "보세요, 하나님께서 저를 아이 못 낳게 하셨어요. 제 여종에게 가세요. 아마 제가 그녀를 통해 자녀를 얻을 수 있을 거예요." 아브람은 사래의 말을 들었어요.

verses.original: Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her servant, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife.
verses.korean: 아브람이 가나안 땅에서 십 년을 산 후에, 아브람의 아내 사래는 이집트 사람인 여종 하갈을 데려다가 남편 아브람에게 아내로 주었어요.

verses.original: He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
verses.korean: 아브람이 하갈에게 갔고, 하갈이 임신했어요. 하갈은 자기가 임신한 것을 알자 자기 여주인을 업신여기기 시작했어요.

verses.original: Sarai said to Abram, "This wrong is your fault. I gave my servant into your bosom, and when she saw that she had conceived, she despised me. May Yahweh judge between me and you."
verses.korean: 사래가 아브람에게 말했어요. "이 잘못은 당신 탓이에요. 제가 제 여종을 당신에게 주었는데, 그녀가 임신하자 저를 업신여겨요. 하나님께서 저와 당신 사이를 판단해 주세요."

verses.original: But Abram said to Sarai, "Behold, your maid is in your hand. Do to her whatever is good in your eyes." Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her face.
verses.korean: 아브람이 사래에게 말했어요. "보세요, 당신의 여종은 당신 손에 있어요. 당신이 좋을 대로 하세요." 그래서 사래가 하갈을 심하게 대하자, 하갈이 도망쳤어요.

verses.original: Yahweh's angel found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain on the way to Shur.
verses.korean: 하나님의 천사가 광야의 샘물 곁에서 하갈을 만났어요. 그 샘은 수르로 가는 길에 있었어요.

verses.original: He said, "Hagar, Sarai's servant, where did you come from? Where are you going?" She said, "I am fleeing from the face of my mistress Sarai."
verses.korean: 천사가 물었어요. "사래의 여종 하갈아, 어디서 왔니? 어디로 가니?" 하갈이 대답했어요. "여주인 사래를 피해 도망치는 중이에요."

verses.original: Yahweh's angel said to her, "Return to your mistress, and submit yourself under her hands."
verses.korean: 하나님의 천사가 하갈에게 말했어요. "네 여주인에게 돌아가서 그녀에게 순종하여라."

verses.original: Yahweh's angel said to her, "I will greatly multiply your offspring, that they will not be counted for multitude."
verses.korean: 하나님의 천사가 또 말했어요. "내가 네 자손을 아주 많이 늘려서 셀 수 없을 정도로 만들겠다."

verses.original: Yahweh's angel said to her, "Behold, you are with child, and will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael, because Yahweh has heard your affliction.
verses.korean: 하나님의 천사가 또 말했어요. "보아라, 네가 임신했으니 아들을 낳을 것이다. 그의 이름을 이스마엘이라고 불러라. 하나님께서 네 고통을 들으셨기 때문이다."

verses.original: He will be like a wild donkey among men. His hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him. He will live opposed to all of his brothers."
verses.korean: "그는 사람들 가운데서 들나귀 같을 것이다. 그의 손이 모든 사람을 치고, 모든 사람의 손이 그를 칠 것이다. 그는 모든 형제들과 맞서서 살 것이다."

verses.original: She called the name of Yahweh who spoke to her, "You are a God who sees," for she said, "Have I even stayed alive after seeing him?"
verses.korean: 하갈은 자기에게 말씀하신 하나님의 이름을 "보시는 하나님"이라고 불렀어요. 그녀가 말했어요. "하나님을 뵙고도 제가 살아 있다니요!"

verses.original: Therefore the well was called Beer Lahai Roi. Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.korean: 그래서 그 우물을 브엘라해로이라고 불렀어요. 그 우물은 가데스와 베렛 사이에 있어요.

verses.original: Hagar bore a son for Abram. Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.
verses.korean: 하갈이 아브람에게 아들을 낳아 주었어요. 아브람은 하갈이 낳은 아들의 이름을 이스마엘이라고 지었어요.

verses.original: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
verses.korean: 하갈이 아브람에게 이스마엘을 낳아 주었을 때, 아브람은 여든여섯 살이었어요.

verses.original: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, Yahweh appeared to Abram and said to him, "I am God Almighty. Walk before me and be blameless.
verses.korean: 아브람이 아흔아홉 살이 되었을 때, 하나님께서 아브람에게 나타나셔서 말씀하셨어요. "나는 전능한 하나님이다. 내 앞에서 바르게 행하여라."

verses.original: I will make my covenant between me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly."
verses.korean: "내가 나와 너 사이에 약속을 맺고, 너를 아주 많이 늘려 주겠다."

verses.original: Abram fell on his face. God talked with him, saying,
verses.korean: 아브람이 얼굴을 땅에 대고 엎드렸어요. 하나님께서 그에게 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: "As for me, behold, my covenant is with you. You will be the father of a multitude of nations.
verses.korean: "보아라, 내가 너와 약속을 맺었다. 너는 많은 나라의 아버지가 될 것이다."

verses.original: Your name will no more be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham; for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations.
